document.masterDocTitle: Hydroids and hydromedusae (Cnidaria: Hydrozoa) from the fjords region of southern Chile

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Hydroids and hydromedusae (Cnidaria: Hydrozoa) from the fjords region of southern Chile

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sertularella gayi: García-Corrales et al. , 1980: 33
, fig. 11.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 15 . A to D:
Sertularella polyzonias
– whole colony (A); fragment of stem with gonotheca (B); two hydrothecae (C); gonothecae (D). E to I:
Sertularella robusta
– stolonal (E) and erect (F, G) colonies; two hydrothecae (H); gonotheca (I). Scale bars: 200 µm (E, F, H); 500 µm (C, I, G); 1 mm (D); 3 mm (A, B).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Material examined . Stn. COM
03 —25.ii.2005
, 15–
25 m
, S69: several fertile colonies and fragments, up to 5.5 cm high, on polychaete tube, 3 slides ( MHNG INVE 53256 )
. Stn. COM
06 —26.i.2006
, 20–
23 m
, S95: several sterile stems, 4–5 cm high, on wood ( MHNG INVE 53344 )
. Stn. COM
07 —25.xii. 2004
, 22 m, S47: four sterile fragments, 2.5–5.5 cm high, 1 slide ( MHNG INVE 53220 )
. Stn. COM
11 —11.ix. 2004
, 26 m, S14: one colony and a fragment, 8 and 5.5 cm high, respectively, both with many gonothecae, and additional smaller, sterile fragments, on rock ( MHNG INVE 53167 )
; 27.i.2006 , 17– 23 m , S97: several sterile fragments, up to 1.8 cm high. Stn. CFA —
14.iii.2006
, 10–
30 m
, S88: several fertile fragments, 3–4 cm high ( MHNG INVE 53325 )
.
Remarks . This well-known species needs no additional comment. For recent redescriptions see Ramil & Vervoort (1992) and Cornelius (1995b) .
World distribution . This is a cosmopolitan species ( Medel & Vervoort 1998 ).

Records from Chile
. Previous records of
S. polyzonias
are from the Canal Trinidad, Punta Arenas, Strait of Magellan, Juan Fernández ( Hartlaub 1905 ), Seno Reloncavi and Golfo de Ancud ( Leloup 1974 ). The present material was collected between 42°10' S and 49°11' S .
